<JD_START>
Job Title: Receiving Inspector Lead

Location: Independence, KS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
SUMMARY: The Receiving Inspector Lead is responsible for overseeing receiving of aviation components and inductions that are due for maintenance and alteration tasks on civil aviation articles in accordance with the current technical data provided in the manufacturers’ Instructions for Continued Airworthiness, Services Bulletins, service letters, Airworthiness Directives, government and industry standard practices, and other data acceptable to or approved by the FAA.

Duties & Responsibilities

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

 Perform detailed inspections of received parts and materials to verify compliance with specifications, quality standards, and regulatory requirements.  Document inspection results, discrepancies, and non-conformances accurately and promptly.  Provide training, guidance, and support to receiving inspection team members to enhance their skills and performance.  Develop and implement training programs to enhance team skills and knowledge.  Read and interpret internal and external customer purchase orders to identify requested work scope of components.  Research component history throughout ERP system.  Perform the Contract Review Process of components during the induction to ensure customer expectations are communicated clearly.  Interact with the Customer Account Leaders/Inventory team to clarify customer expectations as needed.  Perform preliminary detail inspection of component to identify any loose, extra, missing, or damaged parts.  Receive and sign for the freight from delivery services.  Utilize the ERP system to induct internal/external components into work.  Interpret component service bulletins.  Utilize computer skills to communicate customer expectations on the work order and traveling documentation.  Coordinate and induct customer furnished materials into work with the required tracking documentation and clear expectations of the detail piece parts provided.  Provide guidance and training for interpreting component service bulletins.  Collaborate with engineering and production teams to ensure seamless integration of inspected materials into manufacturing processes.  Uphold a culture of safety, quality, and professionalism in all aspects of work.  Other duties as assigned. 

Minimum Requirements 

 Bachelor’s degree.  4+ years of receiving/relevant experience. OR an additional 3 years specific work experience in lieu of degree.  Advanced computer operating skills.  Strong understanding and utilization of ERP system.  Excellent attention to detail, analytical skills, and problem-solving abilities.  Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to collaborate and interact with diverse teams.  Have the ability to read and comprehend customer purchase orders. 
Preferred Requirements

 8+ years of receiving/relevant experience in the aviation industry.  6+ years of contract review experience.  6+ years of ERP system operation. 

Other

 The selected applicant will be subject to a background check and drug testing. 

VSE is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, Protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

At VSE, we don’t just hire employees; we nurture careers and champion well-being. We understand that our success is driven by the people who make up our incredible team, and that’s why we’re committed to providing a workplace that goes beyond just a job-it’s a place where you can truly flourish. When you choose VSE, you’re choosing a company that prioritizes YOU.

Let Us Tell You Why

Time Off: Enjoy Paid Time Off to relax and recharge.

Family Support: We offer Paid Maternity Leave and Paid Bonding Leave, along with access to our Employee Assistance Program, ensuring your family’s well-being.

Education: Pursue your educational goals with Tuition Reimbursement for Undergrad, Technical, and Graduate Programs.

Financial Security: We offer a 401(k) and Employee Stock Purchase Plan to secure your financial future.

Healthcare: Your health is essential, and we provide Health, Dental, and Vision Care.

Flexible Spending: Take advantage of HSA, FSA, and Dependent Care plans for added flexibility.

Insurance: We've got you covered with Short-Term and Long-Term disability insurance.

Competitive Salaries: Your hard work is rewarded with competitive salaries. Ready to be part of a company that values you as much as your skills and expertise?

Join VSE and let’s take your career to new heights while ensuring your well-being every step of the way. Come grow with us. Your future begins here. Apply TODAY!

Apply Now
